name: 臺灣生態進階課程
comment: 本課程在中研院B204教室上課(B204,BRC,AS Campus)
goals: To understand and explore the professional background knowledge of biological ecology
Study the traditional and emerging research techniques of the biological ecology
To understand the relevant knowledge of microbiology, including topics such as biodiversity, physiology and metabolism, molecular genetics, genomics, evolution, ecology, etc.
syllabus:
第一週：Introduction

Course approach, expectations, andweekly schedule

Lecture on the basics and overview ofecology and biodiversity studies: Questions asked, techniques used, modernapproaches (case studies)

Example studies from both marine andterrestrial biology

第二週：Basic concept inmolecular ecology.

What is DNA, RNA, DNA sequencing, use ofDNA sequencing in biodiversity/phylogeny. NGS sequencing and its applications,metabarcoding, etc..

第三週：Lab practical: DNA extraction forSanger sequencing– practice for DNA extraction and PCR

第四週：Supply-side Ecology and hypothesissetup

This lectureintroduces the concept of supply-side ecology and biology/ecology of differentmarine larvae. Introduce the project in this course.

第五週：Sampling strategies and techniques anddata lecture <1 hr lecture>

Sampling of plankton by boat, initialprepping of samples; sampling to test supply side ecology (different depths <halfday>

第六週：Standard morphology, taxonomy,preservation, curation of samples <1 hr lecture>

Sorting specimens by eye and identifymajor groups of larvae <half day practical>

第七週：Learn and fix samples for molecular(and microscopy) studies <1 hr lecture>

Learn DNA, RNA purification (meta, eDNAand single organisms/individuals) <half day practical >

第八週：Barcoding (individual-based), metabarcoding,environmental DNA, metatranscriptomics <1 hr lecture>

Second sampling with aim for NGS or Sequencing<1 hr>

Do/apply sample classification; lab:Simple PCR of organism barcodes (PCR and basic molecular biology)

第九週：Second and third generation sequencingand application to ecology <1 hr lecture>

On-site Oxford Nanopore sequencing withpromising samples or unsequenced species <half day practical>

第十週：Organization and presentation of data obtainedfrom Green Island

第十一週：Bioinformatic analysis of NGS andOxford Nanopore data, part 1 <1 hr lecture>

Prepare eDNA and RNA samples for NGSsequencing <half day practical>

第十二週：Bioinformatic analysis of NGS andOxford Nanopore data, part 2 <1 hr>

Finish preparing eDNA and RNA samplesfor NGS sequencing <half day practical>

第十三週：Learn basics of simple NGS analysisand assembly; introduction to genome annotation and analysis<1 hr lecture>

Computer lab to learn basic command lineinterface; conduct analysis on mock data and real data from class #11 <halfday practical>

第十四週：Teaching manuscript writing 1 (using 'communities'as a focal point) <1 hr lecture>

Annotation of genome or partial genome<half day practical>

第十五週：eDNA and metatranscriptomics data analysispipeline <1 hr lecture>

Analysis of eDNA and metatranscriptomics<half day practical>

第十六週：Teaching manuscript writing 2 (using'behavioral ecology' as focal point) <1 hr lecture>

Guide writing of results and materialsand methods.

Guide good figure and tablepresentations.

Continue analysis of eDNA andmetatranscriptomics

<half day practical>

methodologies.note: 本課程將系統性的介紹生物生態學的背景知識以及新興研究方法與技術
包含學生之口頭報告與討論。
教導學生共同分析研究與討論實驗成果
教導學生分生技術與實驗操作技術
帶領學生實地外調查、採集樣本

grading.note: progress report after Green Island field work
class participation including homework and teamwork

prerequisite: ◎Unavailable for M.A. program students (M.A. program courses excepted) and B.A. program students.
